component.name: Table
component.description: Semantic HTML table primitives with consistent styling, horizontal scroll support, and composable header/body/footer/caption structure.

useCases: Displaying tabular data such as lists of records, transactions, or inventory
Data tables with sortable or filterable columns (via DataTable wrapper)

commonPatterns.name: basic-data-table
commonPatterns.description: A simple table with header and body rows.

commonPatterns.name: table-with-footer-and-caption
commonPatterns.description: A full table with footer totals and an accessible caption.

commonPatterns.name: table-with-checkbox-column
commonPatterns.description: A table with a selection checkbox column for bulk actions.

antiPatterns.reason: Tables should not be used for page layout or grid positioning; they are for structured data only.
antiPatterns.alternative: Use CSS grid or flexbox containers for layout.

antiPatterns.reason: A single-column table adds unnecessary structure over a simple list.
antiPatterns.alternative: Use a styled list or Card-based list layout.

slots.Table: Root wrapper; renders a scrollable container around a <table> element
slots.TableHeader: Contains header rows (<thead>); rows have a subtle bottom border
slots.TableBody: Contains data rows (<tbody>); last row has no bottom border
slots.TableFooter: Contains summary/total rows (<tfoot>); has a top border
slots.TableRow: A single table row (<tr>) with a subtle bottom border and transition on hover
slots.TableHead: A header cell (<th>) with label-md typography, left-aligned, nowrap
slots.TableCell: A data cell (<td>) with paragraph typography, left-aligned, nowrap
slots.TableCaption: An accessible <caption> element below the table

parentConstraints: Table wraps itself in a div with overflow-x-auto for horizontal scrolling on narrow viewports

interactions.horizontal-scroll: The table container enables horizontal scrolling when content exceeds viewport width (min-w-max on the table element)
interactions.checkbox-alignment: Cells containing checkboxes automatically adjust padding and vertical alignment

responsive.narrow-viewport: Table scrolls horizontally rather than collapsing columns; TableHead and TableCell use whitespace-nowrap to prevent text wrapping

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Standard table navigation; interactive elements within cells (checkboxes, buttons) are individually focusable
accessibility.screenReader: TableCaption provides an accessible table description; TableHead cells associate with their column data automatically
accessibility.focusManagement: No special focus management; relies on native table and interactive element focus order

rules: Always include TableHeader with TableHead cells for accessible column labeling
Use TableCaption to describe the table's purpose for screen readers
Keep cell content concise; use Badge or truncation for status indicators
For interactive data tables with sorting and filtering, combine with a DataTable wrapper component
Checkbox columns automatically adjust alignment via [role=checkbox] selectors in TableHead and TableCell
alternatives: Card-based list for mobile-friendly record displays
StatsGrid for numeric summaries without tabular row/column structure

aiHints.context: Use Table and its sub-components for any structured tabular data. These are thin wrappers around native HTML table elements with consistent design-system styling. For advanced features like sorting, filtering, and pagination, pair with a DataTable pattern. The table container handles horizontal overflow automatically.
